subject: Business
title: Brand Loyalty: Beyond Rational Choice
description: A 60-second lesson on Brand Loyalty: Beyond Rational Choice.

hook.text: Blind taste tests show Pepsi wins. But Coke outsells it. Brand loyalty overrides taste buds.

buildup.text: Brand loyalty is an emotional attachment that makes customers choose a product despite rational alternatives.

discovery.text: fMRI scans show that knowing you're drinking Coke activates pleasure centers. The brand itself changes the experience.

twist.text: Loyalty isn't just preference. It's identity. Apple users feel like 'Apple people.' Switching feels like betrayal.

climax.text: Building loyalty takes years of consistent experience. Destroying it takes one viral customer complaint.

punchline.text: People don't buy products. They buy what the brand means to them.

quiz.question: What do brain scans reveal about brand loyalty?
options: Knowing the brand activates pleasure centers that change the experience
Brand loyalty has no neurological basis
All brands activate the same brain regions
